author: Satoshi Nakamoto
content:
Wintermute Asia, a subsidiary of Wintermute Group, a trading firm, has successfully completed its first options block trade on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME), the world's second-largest futures exchange. The transaction involved the BTC/USD block trade, which took place between Wintermute Asia and the prominent TradFi company TP ICAP. The trade was subsequently cleared by ABN AMRO Clearing Bank, as stated in a press release. Block trades are typically significant, privately negotiated transactions between institutional firms, facilitated by a broker. This strategy is widely utilized in the TradFi world. 

Wintermute Asia emphasized that this trade is part of its efforts to meet the increasing institutional demand for exposure to digital assets. Currently, the company offers options in bitcoin (BTC), ether (ETH), and various other altcoins. Evgeny Gaevoy, CEO of Wintermute Group, highlighted the growing number of institutional leaders expanding their portfolios in the digital asset sector and expressed the company's readiness to facilitate trading activity in this space. 

CME has emerged as the second-largest futures exchange, trailing only behind Binance in terms of market share. Crypto derivatives trading continues to dominate the market, comprising nearly 80% of the market share compared to spot trading as of September, according to CCData's data.
title: Wintermute Asia Trades Options Through CME
